lines.text: Since when has a tin-horn gambler the right to order decent people around?
Stop that fighting this moment - - You know good and well that you are behind with your life insurance.
Another Lamb being led to the shearing - eh?
lines.character: Joe Morgan - the Former Mill Owner

lines.text: By Gosh! - - It's that polecat Harvey Green.
You ain't seen that rattlesnake Green around here, have you?
MR. GREEN, isn't here, but he may drop in any moment.
Speaking of dropping, that reminds me that I dropped him once and if he don't quit writing love doings to my piece of calico, I'll drop him again.
The old man is watching me pretty close of late and he give me particular Hades for coming here.
You talk of decency - a rum seller's decency.
lines.character: Joe Morgan - the Former Mill Owner

lines.text: How like a fool you talk as if it were more decent to sell rum than to drink it.
lines.character: Joe Morgan - the Former Mill Owner
